Reviews.Title: Good Camera, But Not Great
Reviews.Author: NatNapoletano
Reviews.Content: Review of Nikon Coolpix P520 by Nat NapoletanoEverything is relative so I will be comparing Nikon's Coolpix P250 to its main competitor the Canon SX50 (they sell for the same price).WHAT NIKON DID RIGHT:Under ideal conditions, the 18.1 megapixel Nikon creates images with higher resolution than the Canon. My images shot at a resolution chart showed that the Nikon had a real resolution of about 12 megapixels (18.1 advertized) and the cannon resolved about 9 megapixels (12 advertized). But under actual conditions, in daylight, they both perform about the same because the Canon has a much better lens. When zoomed or at in high contrast situations, the Nikon makes larger files that are not as clear and sharp as the Canon and have some purple fringing around the edges when blown up.The image sensor in the Nikon is a newer technology and really does perform much better in low light.Nikon has a timer feature that I have found on no other camera. You can set it up to start snapping pictures every 30 seconds, or 1 minute or 5 minutes. This is very cool, you can set it on a tripod and take nature shots all night waiting for a deer to come eat your corn, or you can put together a time laps movie from the frames, or set it up to catch violators in the act. The possibilities are huge! Other cameras, including the Canon, won't do this. (and it would have been so easy in their software)The viewing screen is big and bright. The best I've seen and much better than the Canon.Nikon has a built in GPS. I didn't test it; I'll never use it. Canon doesn't have this feature.WHAT NIKON DID WRONG:The Nikon has focus problems when using the self timer and in movie mode. If you start the movie recording, and then step in front of the camera, it mostly focuses on the back wall and your face is fuzzy. The camera never seems to recover. This is very bad (come on Nikon). I have tried every combination of focus modes. Face detect doesn't seem to work after the movie is recording. I never had a camera this bad. You are forced to use manual focus. This problem does not affect traditional movie recording, focus works fine when you are behind the camera shooting a subject in front of you.In order to use Nikon's electronic viewfinder, you need to fold and tuck the flip out screen. This is a big nuisance on a sunny day going back and forth. Every other camera in the world changes displays using the display button; the Canon does. (and it would have been so easy to implement in Nikon's software, the button is already there)The Nikon camera feels cheap. The lens rattles (but doesn't exhibit any problems) and the flip screen doesn't lock in place. The Canon feels solid as a rock.The charging system that ships with the Nikon uses a cable that charges the battery in the camera. This is a nuisance and I don't need another charging unit with a cord to get tangled in the drawer. So you have to fork out another $30 or$ 40 for a charger and spare battery. The Canon ships with a nice charger that plugs into the wall and holds the battery.All outdoor images are slightly overexposed. This can be corrected by bumping down the aperture 2 stops when shooting, but what was Nikon thinking. The Canon is right on the mark.WHAT CANON DID RIGHT:The Canon super zoom is much more powerful, 50X vs 42X. The Canon lens is truly remarkable. You can photograph the moons of Jupiter on a clear night. I tested it next to the Nikon on distant road signs and you could read text from a mile away using the Canon. There was no comparison. The Nikon doesn't have the range and the image was a little fuzzy at the longest extent compared Canon's superior optics.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good but not 'great'. 24mm-1,000mm lens, Wi-Fi & GPS but no RAW.
Reviews.Author: D. Graves "Fine Books and More"
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a good camera. Not a "great" camera, but a fairly good one. I would consider it high end for the average consumer, with features superior to other point-and-shoots in its price range: Wi-fi capable (ability to connect to iOS and Android devices for viewing/sharing your photos and videos via the optional WU-1a adapter), built-in GPS (to geotag your photos), 18MP CMOS sensor, a zoom lens with incredible focal range (24mm-1,000mm), and 1080 HD video. For the price, that's a nice set-up, a camera with advanced features with a decent ease-of-use, requiring little knowledge of photographic techniques.Many of us, however, want to go beyond 'picture-taking' and seek an advanced camera that is not in an advanced price range. And this is where the P520 is attractive but, ultimately, falls a bit short of our desires. For example, there's no RAW: your images are captured in JPEG only. There's a decent pop-up flash but no hot shoe. Also, the impressive zoom is not so impressive with regard to its speed, either its lens speed (f/3.0-5.9) or autofocus speed (fairly slow but not quite horrible). However, it is a nice, glass, Nikkor lens; and, to be fair, it would be quite a feat to bring such a long zoom well under f/3, given the price range. Personally, I would have traded focal length for speed: yes, it's impressive to go out to 1000mm, but I would have taken 800mm with an f/2.8-5.0 lens; though Nikon has built-in stabilization features for both photos and video (called 'Active VR mode' for video), you're not going to do hand-held shots at that 1000mm focal length, especially video.Other aspects of the camera will please everyone: full manual exposure control along with multiple auto/semi-auto exposure modes, a nice and large tilting Vari-Angle LCD monitor, an excellent CMOS sensor (1/2.3 in.), and a nice weight and feel to the body. This last point is what drew me to the 520 in the first place: I just bought a P310 and although I love it, especially for its small size and portability (shirt pocket), I cannot get used to shooting outdoors with such a small camera. The 520 is just perfect; that solid DSLR feel but with a modest weight (20 ounces).Yes, I wish the P520 had a few more pro-like features and wasn't so extreme in its focal length, but this is a very good camera overall. I'm giving it 3 stars for the reasons stated above. However, if you're someone not interested in advanced photography and just want a very nice camera with higher-end consumer features, this is a borderline 4-star camera and not bad for the price.

Reviews.Title: Nikon P520 Coolpix Camera Dark Gray body (or silver to some)
Reviews.Author: E. Simonson
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research and read reviews as well as YouTube about this camera. Mostly very good comments.Now that I have used this camera for a couple weeks I can say that I made a good decision in purchasing it.I get all the manual control that I had on my old SLR camera,but with this camera it is a lot easier to use and do the the manual settings that I like.One feature I wished it had is Stop Down Metering, I have found no camera of this type that offers this feature either so I didn't mark it down for this.My pictures are very good and the video (which was not the reason I bought this camera) works great even at max zoom of 1000mm which allowed me to get fantastic videos at a recent outdoor concert, as long as I had good lighting the focusing worked great and was pretty fast.The zoom works good and very smooth, the VR (Vibration Reduction) works way better than I imagined at the long Zoom range.I have read some folks wished there was a button to switch between the EVF and the main viewing screen but I like the fact that when I fold the large view screen flat in it's storage area the EVF comes on automatically and when I unfold the large viewing screen it comes on automatically so I have no extra buttons to push.I was concerned about the focusing of this camera as some have mentioned in that it sometimes will not focus sharply.Now that I have this camera and am using it I have found that if I press down the shutter quickly I will sometimes get out of focus photos, but when I press the shutter button part way down (or maybe slowly) the camera has more time to get the correct focus?I have found this seems to be the best method for sharp photos and I have not had any problems since.The Nikon P520 menu system only took me about an hour to make all the settings that I prefer to use which I felt was very easy.Most of all I really like the looks of this camera, it feels great in my hands, very comfortable and not too heavy.The battery last longer than what I was expecting even with using fill flash for many of my sunny outdoor photos, so I can't complain about the battery life.Comes with everything needed to copy photos from the camera to the PC and charging the battery.Same cord that I use to charge the camera battery also copies the photos to the PC as you can remove the AC connector and use the USB end to connect to the PC.The only gripe I have is that there are no threads in the lens barrel to attach a filter to protect the lens glass, for a camera of this type that should be a no brainer.I have ordered a slip on adapter kit for this camera that is threaded at one end for adding filters (the kit also comes with 3 filters), I will see how this works and report on this later.All in all I am enjoying taking photos with this camera, I find myself looking for any reason to go out picture taking, this camera is really fun and I highly recommend it. The price was very fair on Amazon.UPDATE ON THE LENS ADAPTER.I received the lens adapter with 3 filters and one of them being a polarizing filter.The adapter is a hard plastic and slips over the outside of the camera lens barrel, fits nice and tight.There is a small recess in the adapter so that it will only let you push the adapter on to the camera lens just a 1/4 inch so this is really nice and very easy to put on the camera lens, feels very snug and firm.The adapter is threaded on one end where you would screw on the filters, this feels really secure and works well.So I can say that I'm very happy with the lens adapter and the filters it comes with. So far so good.

Reviews.Title: Review for the Average Camera buyer without all the Bells & Whistles
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: Ill start by saying I really dont know much about Cameras. Im just the average Husband whos Wife has been saying for the last couple years that she would love a new Camera. So this Christmas Ive decided to take the jump and buy her this Nikon P520. Now I sat here like most of you are doing reading reviews and after about an hour I realized I still didnt know anything. It seems like a good Camera but then there are the bad reviews also. So I decided to contact an Old Friend that I hadnt spoken to in years who actually is a pretty well knowledged person at one of the Top Camera Companies that you see all the time. After sending him the link to this camera we went back and forth and he explained  all the bells and whistles that this Camera had and also explained the pros and cons. What I came to realize after a couple days and alot of emails was I still really didnt know much about this Camera. So I left him with 2 last questions. 1) Is this Camera worth the money and 2) Is this Camera a Camera that you yourself with all your Camera Knowledge would actually purchase and enjoy. His answer to both of those questions was a very strong YES. Now thats what I needed. I just wanted to hear from someone who knew all the bells and whistles that it would be a Camera he would trust to take the pictures of his life. So I bought this Camera and without going on and on anymore then I already have I can tell you it was the best decision Ive made in a long time. Of course I gave it to her early so by Christmas we would know what we were doing. The pictures are Vivid and Vibrant. 2 words Ive never used in my life. Its easy enough to use for a guy like me but at the same time is capable of keeping the avid photographer happy with all the things its capable of doing. So after all this I would say yes, buy this Camera. We havent had one issue with it at all and it really seems like we made a good choice. Hope this helps the average Camera Buyer a little more then all the other head spinning reviews I sat and read for Hours.

Reviews.Title: Great Trade Off
Reviews.Author: P. Petrasek "The Rev Photos"
Reviews.Content: I use both a Nikon D80 and a D3, as well as a Nikon FE (film). But, when I go on trips and I am concerned about getting a picture quick I only take my Coolpix P520. The controls and capabilities on this camera have produced some marvelous pictures. And, rather than trying to figure which lens to use and changing out lens, I am able to take the fleeting picture. Sure the Coolpix P520 isn't my Nikon D3. But, it certainly does take some very pleasing pictures. In fact,one of my pictures taken by the Coolpix P520 that was posted on line was even chosen as a "favorite" by a professional photographer. To say the least he was quite surprised when he noticed what camera I used. Sure the Coolpix P520 has its limits when you compare it to a DSLR like my D3. But, as is said: "There is a time and place for everything" - even in photography.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: Took this camera to Europe and it did an awesome job.  Took pictures in low light in cathedrals and at night and all turned out well.  Daytime pictures could be controlled with manual exposures, etc.  The close ups were sharp and clear despite some shakiness on my part.  The battery lasted a day and I was impressed that the camera would go into standby mode or turn itself off if not being used.  Love everything about this camera!

Reviews.Title: Not so good...
Reviews.Author: Forest7
Reviews.Content: The Nikon COOLPIX P520 looks like a great camera, and based on the reviews I decided to buy it. It did not take perfectly clear pictures but the camera was complex enough that I thought that it was my problem.  I bought the Photographer's Guide to the Nikon Coolpix P520 by Alexander S. White and I would recommend it as useful to anyone who buys this camera.However, even after working with the manual, trying different settings, autofocus, program, different focus patterns, manual focus, etc. the camera still did not take crisp, clear pictures. It was a disappointment. I did note though that the video camera function seemed to work quite well and actually focus better than the still picture mode.I was able to use a software program and sharpen the pictures and improve them, but they still were not crystal clear.  I compared them to an older Fuji Finepix that I have that is 6MP and has a total 19X zoom. Most of the time whatever it can physically include in its field it can take pictures of clearly.  And the macro is very good, better than this Nikon 520.  Speaking of the 18.1 MP rating of the Nikon, I have found that 6MP make very clear prints on an 8 1/2 x 11 sheet of photography paper and don't see the need for such high MP values.I'm not saying I'm the final word on this camera. There are many that like this camera, and have had success with it.  I returned mine and wanted to share this experience since others' reviews have been useful to me.

Reviews.Title: Software V1.0 -- Not ready for prime time: Fuzzy focus, short battery life, frequent lockups!
Reviews.Author: J. Ware "Green Man"
Reviews.Content: My Nikon P520, Firmware Version 1.0, will be returned for credit first thing in the morning --After shooting over 1,500 images, I have had it with this camera!I have owned several other Nikon and Kodak digital cameras that worked much better than this one...What Nikon did well on the P520:Low-light performance.What Nikon needs to work on IMMEDIATELY:Autofocus: Often fuzzy, almost always slow, somewhat unpredictable, sometimes balky.Frequent Software Lockups: The P520 will lock up frequently when in use, often when "just sitting" there between shots.  In these situations, no combination of controls including Power On/Off will unlock -- you must open the battery door, and physically remove and replace the battery.Short Battery Life: The P520 will unpredictably, and very quickly, run out of power; and IT CANNOT BE RECHARGED WHILE POWERED ON.  This means that any sort of time-lapse photography is out of the question. Nikon must come up with better power-management software, and/or higher-capacity batteries -- and provide for live charging.Ergonomics: The method of switching display between the LED and the eyepiece is clumsy at best.The menus are also seriously in need of work!Outdoor overexposure: The P520 does not handle daylight well, and even with flash does not handle backlit scenes as well as my other Nikons, or Kodaks.The GPS: Software is flaky and hard to manage -- this feature set must be reworked.Will I try another Nikon soon?I suppose so -- but this one really leaves me wondering if the Nikon people care about the quality of their software!Come on Nikon, step up to making a quality product before you release it to the consumers!

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera, takes great pictures
Reviews.Author: L. Hinrichsen
Reviews.Content: This camera has been perfect for me. I'm just an everyday user and the camera is easy to figure out, and takes good quality zoom pictures.The camera is lightweight. The zoom lens is integrated, unlike the DSLRs that have removable, heavy, lenses. This also means there's less chance of dirt or moisture getting in there. The lens is versatile and I'm loving the 42x zoom.I like that you can flip and tilt the LCD viewing screen. You can flip the screen out and turn it all the way around so the person being videotaped can see themselves.  You can also hold the camera high above your head, or way off to the side, and tilt the screen so you can still see the subject of your photo/video. I like that you can fully close the LCD facing the camera to protect it, or close and keep the LCD facing outwards - whatever your preference. I put a clear protective film on my LCD screen.I didn't realize the camera doesn't come with a battery charger! Duh! You have to plug the camera into an outlet to charge the battery inside. Make sure you buy a charger with at least a couple of extra batteries.I was very confused that this and other comparable cameras didn't have Image Stabilization, especially with such a powerful zoom lens. I finally figured out that this camera has something called "VR" Vibration Reduction) which seems to be the same thing.I love the red color. It's beautiful.

Reviews.Title: Nikon wasn't even on the Radar until.....
Reviews.Author: M. Sims "m.sims"
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for a new digital camera and started out looking at entry level SLR's but after reading great reviews about the Canon Rebel T3i, I got to thinking about searching for camera that have some of the benefits but that are present in a mega zoom camera.  My last three camera's are all Panasonic Lumix's and I was looking there but did not see the sense in going from a 20 optical zoom to a 24.  So I narrowed it down to the Canon Sx50 based on reviews and youtube videos.Well after doing my diligent research on the web, starting here of course, I always go into local stores and test drive these babies to see how I feel about it, and although the Canon is a great camera, it's not like I really needed a new camera, I just wanted one.  I stumbled into HHGregg and while looking, I noticed the Nikon and thought.... thats a real low price for that type of camera.It looks a lot like the Canon with the pivoting swing out LCD screen but it was priced like $160 less than it sells for. Someone had mis-priced it on the floor.  I had not heard of the camera before and knew nothing about it.  So once the manager agreed to sell it to me for the incorrect price, I got comfortable, whipped out my cell phone and came here and started reading reviews.  YES, I still needed to do my research.  I purchased the camera!  Here is my take after having it for a couple of days:Pros:- Great pics- Has wi-fi enabled feature (that's next for me to try out once I get the adapter) It only works on Apple and Android phones I have read.- Has GPS (although I opted not to turn that on to save battery life, but I guess I should test it)- Great feel with the rubber handle grip.  I found it very sturdy.- I love the LCD flip out monitor.  You can do so many things with it, and it's only available in a few models in this price range.- Similar to the Canon Sx50 but cheaperCons:- It is not a out the box point n shoot camera.  I had to tweak it in the "P" mode and selected AF-F (Full-time AF) to get clearer pics on zoom (Thx for great customer service Nikon)- It makes more noise when engaging the zoom than I like.  I was told by CS to return it for an exchange and I plan to do that tomorrow.  However, I'm not sure if this is just the way they are. Will see....- It is not a clear shot camera, you will need to wait a sec for it to autofocus which can cost you quick shots in a pinch or pics maybe being fuzzy.That being said, it is still a great camera, especially since I got it new at such a reduced amount due to in-store pricing error.  I didn't want to pay the $450 in the store for the Canon and with the mispriced Nikon since I did not have to.  It does not have the same extended zoom as the Canon camera but long is never enough, if you can get longer I guess.  (Amazon.com sells the Canon for $369 right now. )I've taken some really awesome pics both indoors and outside, but price being equal, I would suggest the Canon Sx50 at $369 here on Amazon because I think it takes better pics without the tinkering and has more versatility with a better zoom,( has a horse shoe and it takes pics in Raw. Not that I would actually use those features).Finally, shop around if paying more is going bug you when you find out later.  Right now here on Amazon the Nikon sells for $376.P.S. I don't know if anyone has tried the Eye-Fi wireless sd cards, this might work in the Canon, which would bridge that whole wireless feature gap.SD Card Tip: if you have a SD card laying around the house, do yourself a favor and Format it before you use it. When I put my old SanDiskHC 4 GB size card into the Nikon it showed that I only could take 91 pics before formatting, then after formatting it, it went up to like 3,000 or something. LolThese are the SD cards Nikon recommends  SD memory card---  SDHC memory card 2---  SDXC memory card 3 SanDisk  2 GB 1  /4 GB, 8 GB, 16 GB, 32 GB  /64 GB, 128 GB TOSHIBA  2 GB 1  /4 GB, 8 GB, 16 GB, 32 GB  /64 GB Panasonic  /2 GB 1  4 GB, 8 GB,16  /GB, 32 GB  64 GB Lexar  --  /4 GB, 8 GB, 16 GB, 32 GB  /64GB, 128GB

Reviews.Title: it's awesome
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: This is really the first good camera I have owned.  I usually just use my iphone to take picture but I decided to invest in a better camera and I am very happy with my purchase.  I also bought 4 extra batteries and a 32gb sdhc card which allows me to take about 3400 pictures on highest quality (the file size for each image is about 7 MB).  Each battery only lasts about 200 pictures so make sure you get extras if you plan on taking extended photography trips.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, right size, amazing zoom, very high quality photos
Reviews.Author: Network Pro "cubanomx"
Reviews.Content: In my recent trip to New York I purchase this camera at BestBuy. I was unable to get this model in Amazon due to business trip timelines, but I want to share some info about this camera.Initially, the camera looks pretty solid, the hand grip is very good. The lcd display is definitely super high quality. One of the best features of this camera is the amazing 42x optical zoom and the full hd video quality! I have some real cool videos of Time Square at night and really really looks amazing!I take some photos using the zoom and the auto mode in central park, so I invite you to look in the sample photos section.with 18.1 megapixels and cmos sensor, you cannot go wrong. Please don't go for the coolpix l820 model, this is just better! The lcd screen have vari-angle so you can move it and rotate to take even better angle pictures!I don't use the GPS feature but is a cool one for the travelers to create point of views and save gps information on the photos. I purchased an extra battery and extra memory card (8 and 16GB) because the camera only have 16MB internal. I love this camera, is not a professional unit but is a really good device. Recommend it!

Reviews.Title: The best compact camera I have ever used ...or seen!
Reviews.Author: C. F. Poza
Reviews.Content: The first trip out was to Mount Rushmore. I was able to take close-ups of Washington's lapels, Jefferson's nose, Teddy's spectacles and Lincoln's beard from the amphitheater with 18 MP. This is an outstanding small camera with more quality and versatility than most. You can pack it anywhere, use it anywhere and get outstanding results on pretty much any task.I am very happy with this purchase and I plan to take the Nikon P 520 on every trip on my schedule. I am not the one to talk technical details, but for all amateurs like me, who like good shots of beautiful and/or interesting subjects by having the right  equipment to honor what we see in the way we wish to frame it, this is a top rated choice. No excuses or exceptions.

Reviews.Title: takes great shots INDOORS.....and out!
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Quinn
Reviews.Content: many months i have searched for a camera that takes quality photos in my somewhat dark home.  saw this bridge camera at target for only one dollar more than amazon and (after returning 3) tried it, realizing the reviews weren't that great.I LOVE THIS THING!!!my canon rebel t3i was "busy" most of the time, so not many shots.  my pentax k-30 was color blind!  neither would shoot in total darkness.most of my pics are taken inside or backyard at night around a fire with family/friends.  don't care much about video, but my short test video seems to work well.zoom fully extended, stills are very clear with no tripod. i don't wait to focus, just point and shoot.  this camera isn't slow, although i am no expert in that area.  had an old kodak slr, and it finally died.  there is much to learn on my new one.  right now i use auto mode changing scenes and using flash as needed.  i am getting good shots!there is no button to transfer from lcd monitor to viewfinder.  that's ok as i usually use the small viewfinder anyway.  and i don't fully open the monitor when needed, just flip it out to the side so it's faster to close.that's it.  for me, it's a very good camera.

Reviews.Title: This is a very impressive camera
Reviews.Author: Old Marine "old_marine"
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I own a Nikon D-800, an 800E, and an F6 for taking B&W; film photos.  For the money, the P520 may be the best bargain in the history of photography.  The software flexibility relative to exposure and modes is amazing.  How many cameras under $500 allow you to shoot in B&W; or sepia, (cyanotone as well), offer a 24-1000mm zoom capability, and offer RYG or O filtering in monochrome mode?  When you consider A, S, P, M or full automatic exposure modes and 18.2 Meg resolution, this camera is incredible for the price.  Only negative is a GPS receiver in place of a hot shoe, but for some reason Nikon thinks that everyone in the world wants to record Lat/Lon on every photo they take,  Please produce a 530 with every feature of the 520, but do away with the GPS and include a hot shoe.

Reviews.Title: still getting used to it - but has potential
Reviews.Author: Sherry K. Kuhl "Loves to Read"
Reviews.Content: This camera is way cool to look at.  Ok, looks aside, I'm still trying to get used to some of the features of this camera.  In comparison to my comparable canon, there are some pros and some cons.  The pros: reaction.  This camera has a great reaction.  When you press the button to take your picture, it has a smooth and quick depression and you can really quickly take several pictures in a short amount of time with little effort.  I also like the transition between the viewfinder and the LCD display, it's quick and easy and converts from one to the other fast.  This camera also has a slightly better (more powerful) zoom than my other auto zoom camera and it seems so far that the stabilization is a little better, too.  Cons:  some of the features are a little confusing to go between, focusing is not quite as easy with this camera as with my Canon and while I think I have something in focus when I look at the picture, it's not.  That may simply be an adjustment that I still have to make to the camera, but out of the box it seems a littler harder to get the focus right with this one than with the other one.  This camera also goes to sleep or blanks out after a very short time of no activity; so if you have zoomed out and are waiting for, say, a fawn to get in range for a shot, be wary - the camera will blank out on you after about 20 seconds and you will have to "wake" it back up again.  Hopefully you didn't miss your shot in that process.  My other camera does this as well, but I don't believe the time is as short as with this one.

Reviews.Title: P520 -Focus not great
Reviews.Author: Carriec
Reviews.Content: After using my Nikon P520 for two months now, with light usage, I must say I am disppointed in the lack of good, crisp images. The autofocus is just not very accurate, and 80% of the time the images come out just a tiny bit off. Things improve a little when I select the shutter speed priority button -"S". Am seriously considering returning it, to get a true single lens reflex, a camera with a sharp sensor. Bottom line: Very mediocre camera.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased!
Reviews.Author: ashley hall
Reviews.Content: The camera takes GREAT pictures, and the zoom is amazing! I am not a professional by any means, but I enjoy taking photos, and with this camera its so easy to do! I would defiantly recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: I feel like a pro. Takes all the guess work out for a novice!
Reviews.Author: Brett Allan Stroud
Reviews.Content: GREAT CAMERA - good pictures and video - everything I was looking for. The Zoom is also outstanding.CONS - The camera does not fit in the case that came with it. It has accessorie pockets that look like it could hold all your stuff until you place it or accually cram it in the case. But it is just a camera case and the camera is awesome. Just get another case. Completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Hoping for more....
Reviews.Author: Allison J Row
Reviews.Content: It could very well be me not having a chance to really understand the camera yet.  I am coming from a Cannon that shoots super fast....this just did not do that for me.  HOWEVER, I really liked having it and using for our vacation shots in NYC. I just will not be using it for my kids sporting events.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera. It's easy to use even for a beginner!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I love the features and it's very easy to use. The zoom is incredible and the picture quality is great! Also it has allot of pre set picture settings to. You can't go wrong with this camera. Great job!

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Andy A.
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, this is my first high end camera and I have learned so much on photography and taking pictures. the adjustable lcd is a very good feature to use for good angles.

Reviews.Title: Comparison: Panasonic FZ70 vs Canon SX50
Reviews.Author: Kimberly R. Norton

} } } Length:: 0:53 MinsHere is the low down on the:---Panasonic LUMIX DMC-FZ70 16.1 MP Digital Camera with 60x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3-Inch LCD (Black),---Canon PowerShot SX50 HS 12MP Digital Camera with 2.8-Inch LCD (Black),---Nikon COOLPIX P520 18.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 42x Zoom Lens and Full HD 1080p Video (Black) (this camera).The video shown is with the respective camera to show the zoom quality of that camera. (The videos were compressed). On the Pany and Nikon, when you move the zoom lever all the way to the right then you are at maximum optical zoom. The canon is a little tricky because if not careful you will end up using the digital zoom because moving the lever all the way to the right puts you in digital zoom mode.IMAGE QUALITYNone of these cameras will look as good as a dslr.---The Pany was true to color and appeared to have built in HDR ( when taking an image where half is in the shade and the other half sunny, the Pany took two images then automatically combined them).---The Canon looked a little washed out but images still looked nice.---The Nikon takes the best images IF the subject is static, but if you have a moving object expect to get blurry images from the Nikon.ZOOM CAPABILITIESBased on 35mm equivalents, you have the following for wide angle through telephoto.....Panas (FZ70)...60X... 20mm - 1200mm....Canon (SX50)..50X... 24mm - 1200mm....Nikon (P520)....42X... 24mm - 1000mmThe viewfinder and LCD on the Pany appear not to capture the entire area, once the image is on the computer it appeared to have a wider angle of view. The extra wide angle is really nice.SOUND QUALITYThe Panasonic appear to have the best microphone of the bunch and hence the best sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Works great, when it works
Reviews.Author: S. Shadday
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great photos, esp. macro shots.  The only complaint I have with it is that on the camera I received, the focus doesn't always work.  Doesn't matter what setting I use or which AF area mode I select, there are times when the camera just refused to focus, even when it has a clear view of what I want to shoot.  It will briefly focus, then go back out of focus and stay there.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Ann Rast
Reviews.Content: Great camera; easy to use, and takes great pictures.  Love the powerful zoom lens.  Only con is that the lens cap comes off too easily.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Stv S
Reviews.Content: For the money, this is by far the very best camera i ever owned.  Had it 2 days and went to Asia with it. Flawless, simple to use, super zoom.well worth the bucks.  go for ito yeah, killer good video

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: G. Gehlken
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and takes fabulous photographs.  Am pleased with my selection.  Very light weight compared to upper end digital cameras and well balanced.

Reviews.Title: A quality camera by Nikon!
Reviews.Author: carverman
Reviews.Content: The 18 MP makes this camera stand out in the "point and shoot" category. The variable screen protector is excellent, and really protectors screen from scratching and damage. So far my experience has been very positive.

Reviews.Title: I L.O.V.E. It!
Reviews.Author: Bel Dezas
Reviews.Content: I had been looking at upgrading from my Sony point and shoot to a digital SLR but I wasn't sure if I wanted to invest a minimum of $600 for a camera and an additional $400 for another lens.  This camera was the answer! I know it isn't a DSLR but it's very close.  It arrived a day before expected and I stayed up past 1am trying to learn as much as I could.  I still have a lot to discover but I figured if I can master ISO, aperture, shutter speed and so on with this camera then maybe in a couple of years I can make the investment for a DSLR.I am extremely happy with the quality of this camera and cannot wait until my SD card gets here so I can begin saving photos!

Reviews.Title: Power Button Issue
Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: The zoom function is great, that's why I purchase it. But the power button gets a little problem. Sometimes it's hard to power on the camera, the power button just doesn't give any responses. You have to push hard or try many times, sometimes you even need to take out the battery and put it back to start the camera. This issue really brought me some problems when I was travelling, put me in an embarrassing situation.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Janet Bozynski
Reviews.Content: The camera is slow to recover from a shot. The zoom is blurry at times. I've had the camera 8 months and just sent it to the company for trouble shooting as to why the camera will not charge a battery anymore. (at my cost of shipping by the way) I wish I would have returned it.

Reviews.Title: Quite a nice camera
Reviews.Author: William Cook
Reviews.Content: I am not photo-guru and this is my first camera which cost more than $100.  It takes excellent pictures and for someone with hands that are a bit shaky, it prevents pictures from coming out blurry.  It also takes very nice pictures at night even without using the flash.

Reviews.Title: Wooow!
Reviews.Author: Berny
Reviews.Content: As a photographer, I have recommend and bought this Coolpix to many friends and family and have not received any bad comments. The quality of the pictures is stunning for its size!

Reviews.Title: I have found out that Nikon is one of top Digital Camera's on the market now.
Reviews.Author: Donald C. Szymanski
Reviews.Content: I have just goy myself this Nikon Coolpix P520 18.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 42x Zoom Lens. I have already made a test run taking pictures around my home town as they came out real good Tops. I  got this here Camera so one can have it ready for my tripback to Disney World for next year May 5-8-2014.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Egon Keltai
Reviews.Content: Excelent camara.I am enyoing it. I have the FTN and F3 film camaras, but this is an easy to use equipment.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Dan the Man
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this camera for the average point and shoot person who wants to have the ability to zoom up close to distant items of interest.  There are better cameras out there but for the price point you will not be disapointed.  I use this camera when I am on vacation and love the professional looking photos it produces.  I recommend it to anyone - it just works.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Sebastian Paquette
Reviews.Content: I very much like this new Nikon camera.  The price was fair, the delivery on time.  This is the fourth Nikon camera I have owned, and I have been more than satisfied with all.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Christina Jennings
Reviews.Content: I recently developed an interest in photography.  This camera is perfect for a beginner. I am having such a great time learning with it.  I love the zoom. It is incredible!.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Super Zoom
Reviews.Author: David Huchital
Reviews.Content: I tried both this and the Sony and chose the Nikon for superior color fidelity. The zoom capability is excellent and the dense focal plane ensures a high resolution photo. The negatives, as others have pointed out, are that the focus is a tad slow and it feels a little cheap and plasticky. But having said that, it's light enough to throw in your camera bag without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: A trade off
Reviews.Author: Ralph E. Decker
Reviews.Content: I got this for an upcoming vacation I am taking.  I did not want to carry by DSLR and a Video Camera.  I was hoping this would meet both needs.  It works Okay in video mode if the light is good.  For indoors you need a good deal of light or the video is too dark.  I contacted Nokia who said 'it is working within specs.'Also - battery life is bad.  Get extra batteries.  GPS really eats them up and, by the way, the GPS receiver is not that good.  Indoors, when even my HTC One X gets a solid signal, the camera will not lock to GPS.The lens is very good and the sill picture quality is excellent.  JPG compression is pretty high (4 and 8 times).  Would be nice if Nikon offered a less lossy mode.Anyway - It's okay.  If I had to do it again, i would have spend a few extra bucks and gotten a higher end camera that is outside the Coolpix line.

Reviews.Title: Poor auto focus - blurry pictures
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: The camera has a wonderful zoom range, macro mode and other features such as panorama, GPS, HDR that I like.  My brother has one and had recommended this one.  However its pictures are not as sharp as those of my 12mp Canon SX-20IS that this camera was supposed to replace.  I took a number of comparison shots and, particularly at full telephoto, the Nikon pictures were out of focus.  I got more detail out of my Canon which has half of the zoom capability.  I returned the camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: dmally
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera.  I am new to photography and was looking for something more than a typical point and shoot camera.  I did a ton of research and was torn between a true DSLR which would probably require me to take a photography class to learn how to use or a fancier point and shoot.  I wanted a higher MP so I could enlarge photos beyond 5x7 and I wanted to be able to zoom in close on wildlife.  This camera had both without the need to take a collage class to learn how to use it.  I am still learning what all this camera will do, but  I can say that the photos I have taken have been fantastic.  I asked my friend if I could use her daughter as my guinea pig and take some senior photos of her (for practice).  WOW!  They were so great that she choose to use them :)  Crisp and clear and on the automatic setting with use of a tripod.  I also got some great landscape and wildlife photos that are fantastic.  I am thrilled with this camera.  It is the perfect camera for someone who is new to photography but wants professional quality photos.  Thanks Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for picture lovers.
Reviews.Author: Fran
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for the picture lovers and also for begginers. Amazing picture quality, light and very easy to use.The 42x zoom is nice, but user has to be steady while shooting at max zoom.

Reviews.Title: Advanced features not working yet
Reviews.Author: Casper Chauncey
Reviews.Content: You don't have to take my word for it. Go check Nikon's web site. Amazon won't let reviewers post links but go to Nikon's site and search for firmware update for this P520 camera. Their page listing firmware updates DOESN'T EVEN KNOW THIS CAMERA EXISTS as of the date of this review, much less have an update available.My camera came with firmware 1.0. Well, simply, it isn't finished. Many of the advanced features described and illustrated in the user manual just AREN'T THERE. The ones that are don't work reliably. I got this especially for the GPS feature. It is slow to lock and keeps losing lock, even though it is allegedly "always on" once you enable it. After recording GPS coordinates for awhile you have to choose an option to "Save" them. Well where were they up to now if not saved? Anyway, I choose save and the camera just locks up totally. None of the buttons work. It has been an hour now and it is still locked up. Not even the automatic screen dim after a few minutes (which you can't adjust -- another feature they didn't get around to programming yet) is kicking in.I'm a software programmer and I recognize this as the symptom of half-baked software rushed to market before it is done. The camera itself seems great physically. Maybe in a year or two they'll finish the software and this will be a good camera. But not now. Many of the settings described in the owners manual are simply unusable in its current state.Finally, by looking at their other products, I can see that even if there WERE a firmware update available, they wouldn't let ME have it. You see, you have to run a Windows program that creates a firmware.bin that you put on your camera's memory card. Well that is just stupid. Just give us the firmware.bin file directly! Then we can all use it -- not just Windows people!A company this ignorant and careless about software does not deserve one dollar of my money.

Reviews.Title: After 4 months of use . . .
Reviews.Author: Lin
Reviews.Content: My desire was for the maximum bang in the most compact camera package.  This is perfect for me.  My photographs are remarkable.  Clarity is amazing.  Zoom is spectacular.  Low light capabilities are unbelievable.  Speed of warm-up and operation is incredibly fast.  I'm impressed!!!  If I could give it more stars, I would.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Pictures, Great Low Light but Slow and Freezes Sometimes
Reviews.Author: PenName
Reviews.Content: I like taking pictures but am no expert.  I am still debating whether to keep this camera.  I have had it for about 3 months.The camera just seems slow - whether it is powering up or focusing.  I know I should not expecting miracle with a bridge camera but I have missed some nice shots.  My old Canon S3 (which is quite a few years old) does not seem to be much slower.  Worse - sometimes nothing happens when I push the shutter button on the P520 - it seems to be hung up on focusing or something.The bright side is the pictures are beautiful.  I am especially impressed by the low-light performance.  Battery life is OK - I have the GPS turned off and use the viewfinder.I did have 2 or 3 freezes in the last 2 weeks.  Basically, the camera became unresponsive to anything.  I had to pull the battery out to reset it.  I don't feel it is a hardware problem - it seems like a software timing thing.  Once it was in the middle of shooting a video (and the memory card was still pretty empty).  It seems others have reported this too.  (I bought this camera in November 2013 so it probably has newer versions of any software.)  Obviously not good for a camera to do this.  Luckily, the memory card remained intact (i.e. not corrupted by the problem and my solution(.One thing that really bugs me is I can't figure out how to disable the automatic displaying on the viewfinder of the picture I just took.  There is got to be a way to disable that, right?

Reviews.Title: Impressive zoom capabilities, Compact package
Reviews.Author: Zane A. Undercoffer
Reviews.Content: So my wife told me a few weeks back she wanted to get a more real camera. Neither of us is a photographer, we have no real interest in photography. She wanted it so she can take pictures of the kid, and the pets, and our activities in higher quality and resolution than her cell phone or our cheap point and shoot cameras could offer. More to the point, when she has them printed out professionally, she wants them to look nice -not pixely or distorted.THE SEARCH BEGINSSo costco has the nikon DSLR's. I have a photographer friend who bought one and has had good results using it and says it's a real good value. It's also $1000. That's a bit excessive for us, as we wouldn't know where to even begin with such a camera. There's also higher-end point and shoot cameras, which are probably pretty good as the MP's of them have really risen in the past few years. However, the problem is they don't zoom, or don't zoom very far. And once you use the digital zoom feature, your resolution goes downhill in a hurry and you generally lose image stabilization, so taking a non-blurry picture becomes nigh-impossible.Actually didn't know about this line of cameras at all. I typed in "digital camera" into amazon's search engine and started browsing. Didn't get very far, so I decided I'd look at nikon's offerings as I owned a higher end film nikon back in the day and my friend uses nikon exclusively. This camera's lower end version was on the first page of "nikon digital camera", and after looking at the different options I settled for this one.THE CAMERA:The device itself is impressive. It's not as big as a DSLR, most notably it doesn't have a giant honking disconnectable lens hanging off the front of it. What is present is the HUGE built in auto-zoom lens, the flip around screen, and the selector wheel. I love that the wheel is made of actual steel (or I presume steel) and the edges are coarse so it's easy to use in your fingers. Each selection has a very positive detente, so there's no question about what setting it's on and it definitely does NOT feel cheap. The flip around screen is large and has good resolution. I'm not really sure why it flips around, and if I ever find a use for that feature I'll update this review. The body is weighty, but not super heavy and feels good in your hands and overall has a real good look to it.THE ZOOM:It has a little selector on the lens body which puts it into manual mode which is a real nice feature. I've yet to use it, but if I was more of a pro photographer I could see needing it for faster action shots at a distance. The zoom on this camera is impressive. I'm so glad I purchased the higher end version with the big zoom as you can really take distance pictures easily.THE VIDEO:It really amazes me that I can own a device for a reasonable sum of money which takes this good of video and pictures at the same time. The video is great, there's no other way to put it. I don't feel like I've settled for a combo device which does nothing well. This camera seems to do it all well. The audio isn't the best-best, but it's infinitely better than a cell phone video which is all we require from it.THE FEATURES:Read the manual, it has them in spades. Honestly, I've yet to use even half of them. But for taking quality pictures and videos, and a great zoom feature this camera seems to do no wrong. Also, it's worth mentioning that you can't use filters with this camera as it's presently configured. However the lens is somewhat threaded and they sell adapters that allow you to use filters. Honestly, I don't have any expertise in that department so I don't know if I'll ever do that.SUMMARY:This camera is more than enough for your average picture taker. My friend toyed around with it for a bit, and his thoughts were that if I ever get bored with this camera a proper DSLR will be the next step, but for my uses it's so far beyond adequate it's unlikely. I'm very pleased with this purchase and so far have not had any issues with it's usage.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ray Parks
Reviews.Content: very light and takes above average pix with a great optical zoomI own several more expensive Nikons and this one is a great surprise as to the picture quality and simple to use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Carl R. Cook
Reviews.Content: LOVE this camera. Pictures so clear. I live in WY with so many animals and the mountains. YES people buy this camera

Reviews.Title: What a great camera!
Reviews.Author: Ken01 "Ken01"
Reviews.Content: It has 42x Zoom = incredible!  FAVORITE FEATURE for me: Allows one to have the date print out on the pictures, if you want it, even if you have pictures printed out at a CVS or Walgreens type place (my old Pentax would NOT do that) - this camera will save me a ton of time, from having to manually enter the date on the pictures at the developing store machines.  Also, the back view screen is amazing quality!  And the low-light pictures are almost better than real life (they REALLY approximate the exact lighting/colors in really low light!).  Simple set-up, and great features.  I myself don't use the GPS function, but it is there if you need it.This camera is a must-have!!

Reviews.Title: :D
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I am NOT a professional photographer nor inclined to be one. But I wanted something with good quality photos and easy to operate. I absolutely LOVE IT!!!  Even has the manual focus my husband wanted for some weird reason.  Great pics, great features, great video.  Couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Suzie in Denver
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  My granddaughter saved her birthday and allowance money to buy this.  She loves it.  Her grandfather is so impressed, he wan'ts one for himself.  It took great pictures.

Reviews.Title: very nice camera
Reviews.Author: dr. foto
Reviews.Content: This is my second camera and the best one. It's really good. The zoom is incredible and it's very ease to use this camera; you can have very good photos.

Reviews.Title: TOO MANY PROBLEMS
Reviews.Author: WILLIAM ABERNATHY
Reviews.Content: We have owned several Nikon cameras, and this is the 1st one we did not like.  I returned it.  The image quality was poor, the zoom was difficult to control, the image was blurry at high magnification, and there was an excessive time delay between consecutive shots.  The menu for advanced functions was not intuitive and was not easily accessed.  The paper manual that came with the camera was brief and did not direct you to the complete 240 page manual online.

Reviews.Title: A mistake in design.
Reviews.Author: Julio Ortega Bobadilla "JOB"
Reviews.Content: I have always trusted on Nikon, but the P510 and the P520 cameras have a problem. You can not put a conventional filter on your lens, neither 52, 48 mm are suitable. You have to buy an adaptor to 67 mm (that isn't Nikon brand), and then look for the filters (uv, polarizer, etc) at your own risk. I'm happy with the camera but I expected more support from Nikon. Nikon COOLPIX P520 18.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 42x Zoom Lens and Full HD 1080p Video (Black)

Reviews.Title: This camera is just plain awesome
Reviews.Author: Tarek Halaby "tarekzh"
Reviews.Content: Awesome piece of equipment took a few pictures with it yesterday and I love love love it!!!!!!!!!! the clarity of the pics detailness so sharp I was going back and forth between the Canon sx50hs and finally decide on the ones

Reviews.Title: Coolpix P520 Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Hammercl
Reviews.Content: The camera was well packaged, Easy to operate, instructions were very good, shipping time was acceptable, was as described on the Web Page. The only issue is if you run the GPS on the camera, you can only take about (30) pictures before it completely drains a battery. I did not find this information anywhere in the instruction manual and found out the hard way when the battery died and the camera would not turn on. This is the only downside I have found so far with this camera.....

Reviews.Title: Great if you want an upgrade but not ready for DSLR
Reviews.Author: Jbean5026
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to upgrade to a "big girl" camera for a while now and after doing some research decided to start with this.  I looked into DSLR cameras but by the time I would have gotten a lens that I wanted it was going to cost upwards of $1000 and after trying one in a camera store I left feeling a little overwhelmed.I just got this in the mail yesterday and was able to quickly figure out pretty much all of the auto settings.  I am really satisfied with the results as this is going to be mainly used for family photos and travel.  I like the idea that I can adjust things manually if I want, so I think this will be a nice camera to sort of learn on and then eventually upgrade again to a DSLR if I end up wanting to.So far, I am impressed with this camera as a beginner and look forward to learning all the ins and outs and producing great photos!

Reviews.Title: I think I would rather have the P510
Reviews.Author: Robert G. "Robert"
Reviews.Content: I have owned a p-100 and a p510 both of which I was pleased with. My problem so far with this camera is the poor quality of the image through the viewfinder and the method they have chosen to use it . The LCD display has to be totally closed (folded in so that it is not visible) to use the viewfinder. This means that the user cannot use the DISP button to switch quickly back and forth between the two. A person who has never used an SLR and enjoyed looking at the crisp through the lens image probably will not care about this.I will comment further when I've had the opportunity to use the camera more--I just bought it to replace my p510 which was stolen. I hope the extreme telephoto is as good as the 510 and the autofocus problems have been remedied.

Reviews.Title: Best point n shoot wildlife camera ever
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Lipshy "wuzupdoc"
Reviews.Content: I read a lot if reviews before purchasing this. I have had a Nikon coolpix for the past 3 years. Prior to that I owned a similar Olympus but Olympus quit putting in a eye view finder and I photograph birds and other fast moving objects so that is a must. I need a camera that I can just grab and go so it cannot weigh much, plus I tend to drop it bang cameras a lot so can't really validate purchasing an slr. Essentially I needed a camera that had a very wide range of focal lengths, decent resolution and did not take several paychecks to purchase. So to all those who whine and complain about the camera..... Sure it's not as good as a 15000 slr w a 800mm lense, that you can then switch to a 29mm lense when you want a scenic view, but common this costs 350.If you don't believe me, the pics on the link below were take about 15-20 yards away- you can see the dried salt on the terns nostrils- that's good enough for me. Oh and the pier I was standing on was moving and there were frequent wind gusts meaning I was never still for long and the motion adjustment was just fine.[...]

Reviews.Title: Exceeded expectations
Reviews.Author: Nikki Hardesty
Reviews.Content: I am a beginning photographer, I was looking for something easy to use that provided awesome quality pictures. I had messed around with a P510 in a store, but then realized the P520 was the "upgrade". I went with my gut instinct and bought this camera. I am SO happy that I did! I have pulled off some shots that I never thought possible, I am overly pleased with this camera!The ONLY gripe that I have so far is that I wish it came with a more in-depth instruction manual. 11 out of 13 pages tell you how to "set the camera up" and then you're pretty much left to your own devices. Finding videos online have helped tremendously.

Reviews.Title: Review for Nikon Coolpix P520 18.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Lori S. Chadbourne
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect camera for me.  I've been looking for one that has a higher zoom than the one I have now.  My other challenge was to find one with a separate viewfinder...so many of the newer digital cameras only come with the LCD on the back of the camera and it's impossible to see anything in bright daylight.

Reviews.Title: Great Digital Camera (No gadget bag required)
Reviews.Author: Old Aviator
Reviews.Content: I have had many cameras over the years but this is one of the best. No fussing with lens changing. Extremely compact for a SLR style camera. Eighteen megapixels and image-stabilization produces sharp, well-lit photos in all lighting conditions. I added a 32 GB Class 10 SDHC Flash Memory Card, so I am ready to shoot all day. Oh yes, it also does 1080p HD videos with stereo sound. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: First big-boy(-ish) camera I've had. I don't have the money to drop on a dslr and wanted more than a silly phone camera. I'm not a very "in your face" person so staying in the back of an event is usually my cup of tea and the zoom helps. A short tutorial on modes, focus, shutter-speed, iso, etc. and people's interest perked up a little when I posted photos.If you feel ignorant about photography but have taken enough cellphone pictures that are blurry, blown out, dark, or just not right this will give you enough room to learn and pass on to a friend or family member. I don't believe I'll stay with this forever but I'll stay with it for now.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful travel camera.
Reviews.Author: Fred Zahnow "Fred the sailor."
Reviews.Content: My days of travel with a bag full of two high end digital Nikon cameras and 8 lenses are over!  This light and small camera has incredible options for still and video!

Reviews.Title: Love Camera
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Cross
Reviews.Content: I'm highly impressed with this camera. I highly recommend this camera for anyone that's a beginner in cameras similar to these. Unfortunately, this model does not have interchangeable lenses. Although, there are multiple different filters for this module. The detail of the photos from this camera are amazing. Also, I highly recommend the user guide for this camera by the title of " Photographer's Guide To The Nikon Coolpix P520" by Alexander S. White. It a very helpful 420 page guide. I ordered mine when I ordered my camera.

Reviews.Title: P520
Reviews.Author: Electronic Tech Geek "Self Employed"
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I decided to go for it. I am very happy with this camera. Not true DSLR and not a pocket camera. Feels god in the hands and it take GREAT photos and videos. One of my main reason to purchase, other than being a Nikon, was because I could wifi my pics to my iPad with the done and it shoots 3D pics. Very cool. The zoom is fantastic. Although it sometimes has a time trying to auto focus, but all in all....Great camera

Reviews.Title: Very good Nikon camera
Reviews.Author: AWF620
Reviews.Content: Nikon cameras have never let me down. I wanted to move up from a basic digital camera with minimal zoom to one where I could capture my grandchildren from a distance while participating in sports.  this one does the trick and the quality is very good. I like the rotating screen as well as the easy access record button for video.

Reviews.Title: A good upgrade to the Nikon Coolpix S9100!
Reviews.Author: Joe M.
Reviews.Content: I got this camera shortly after Thanksgiving 2013 after deciding that I wanted to further increase my skill set in photography. After I pretty much drove my Kodak EasyShare M893 into the ground over three years of use (June 2008-July 2011) and 10,000+ pictures, I got the Nikon Coolpix S9100 in September 2011. Although I still use the S9100 as my general-use camera having taken more than 4,500 pictures since purchasing it, the P520 has now become the third camera I've owned since 2008. It's a well-built, high quality camera with a lot of good features that will produce some stunning pictures under the correct conditions. I have yet to test it to its full extent since at the time of writing this review it's really cold here in southern Minnesota, and I don't dare expose this thing to temperatures of -15!Some positives about the P520:* Indoor pictures turn out great, but you need to know when to use the flash, and when you can compensate using exposure compensation. As an example, I took a really good shot of my family over the Christmas holiday, and although it was slightly overexposed, the lighting conditions inside the residence where the picture was shot was actually relatively dark. Flash and the AF assist light on the front of the camera were important for allowing the shot to come out correctly. During the day, if you're planning to shoot indoors, use the Best Shot Selector (BSS) continuous shooting capability to get the most crisp shots you can.* The number of different image resolutions is excellent for being able to take shots with many different aspect ratios (4:3, 16:9, 3:2, 1:1, etc). Overall, the camera's image resolutions tend to favor 4:3 ratios (for standard-resolution monitors), but I still have two options for taking pictures that will fit my 16:9 widescreen monitor at home perfectly (1920x1080 @ 2MP or 4864x2736 @ 13MP).* Really like to have the power to experiment with aperture priority, shutter priority, and program modes. For an amateur photographer like myself who likes to snap a lot of pictures on campouts with the Boy Scout troop I'm in, this is really a good way to see what settings work best when conditions change frequently.* The way that you can hold the camera just like a regular DSLR is awesome! It's just one way to add to the experience of owning this piece of machinery.* Having the LCD screen tilt and rotate is nice when you need to get the camera into an awkward position or other location where taking a picture would otherwise be inconvenient. You can definitely take some good selfies with this camera! I haven't used the viewfinder enough to know if it's of any practical use since the regular LCD screen is of such high quality (921K dots), but I can say that it's hard to look through it since it really forces me to squint out of one eye pretty tightly. It's uncomfortable at times.Some negatives about the P520:* Would like to see some improvements to the menu system. I think that the reactivity to selecting menu options is nice with the command dial, but using the multi selector dial to select options seems to be a little slower compared to how my S9100 would be able to just breeze through them all.* Yes, the auto focus issue is certainly something worth mentioning here, but that's just something I've learned to deal with even on my S9100. I'm used to it being slow sometimes.* The Nikon-branded case that comes with this camera (if you purchase this as a "kit" instead of just the boxed package) is indeed too small. You won't be able to fit the camera in there unless you cram it. The strap just ends up making an already tight fit worse. As mentioned in the "Photographer's Guide to the Nikon Coolpix P520" book (which I also highly recommend purchasing), you can get the Lowepro Rezo 100 AW camera bag, and this will come with a rain shield which can be draped over the inside of the bag to provide better protection from the elements when necessary.Other thoughts:* Some reviews state that you absolutely have to take the lens cap off before powering on the camera to prevent the lens zoom motors from grinding and generating an error. This is not true -- if you turn on the camera accidentally without remembering to take off the lens cap, it does nothing to hurt the camera in any way since the lens cap would be attached to the lens and not the body. But you will see a very black-colored display if you do end up forgetting to take it off!* Be sure to buy an external EN-EL5 battery charger and spare batteries for this camera. As you normally have to leave the battery in the camera to charge it, I don't know if I would trust leaving a camera as expensive as this unattended (for me at summer camp, this is a high possibility, so the purchase of an external charger was an absolute must).Considering all of these points, my final verdict has to be that this camera has very good potential for becoming the best camera I've owned yet, but I have to test it further to try out all of its built-in features. I'll be updating this post as I find out new things about it.

Reviews.Title: great overall camera
Reviews.Author: Stephen Smith
Reviews.Content: We got the Nikon Coolpix p520 over Christmas.  Over all it is a great camera.  The 42x optical zoom is nothing short of incredible.  It allows me to capture the craters on the moon and with the macro setting turned on, to get detailed rain drops hanging off leaves.  The shutter speed is also great – ranging from 1 to one four-thousandths of a second.  There are no stock lens filters available for this camera which was disappointing because I wanted to fit it with a UV filter to protect the lens.  Also the aperture limited to F:3 TO F:8.4 which doesn’t give the same control of depth of focus as I had wanted.  For the price I would definitely recommend this as an all-around capable and reliable camera  that is capable of taking stunning images.

Reviews.Title: Everyone's Camera
Reviews.Author: Harry Tutton "Trumpet Dad"
Reviews.Content: From the days of my Argus C-3 years ago I have enjoyed taking photos of my travels and now my family.  I welcomed the  change from Kodak film to digital photography - what an incredible change.  For a few years I enjoyed using a basic Canon point and shoot and it served me well.  Now with the Nikon CoolPIX P520 I have a better zoom lens and more pixels.  It took me only a few minutes to learn how to use the camera and I would certainly buy the camera again.  I am happy to recommend this as a camera for everyone.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Long Zoom Camera
Reviews.Author: Luke
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for someone looking for DLSR quality without the complication of the DSLR. I really love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX P520 - Good Buy
Reviews.Author: Gail-Ann Baptiste
Reviews.Content: A fine piece of equipment, it works well and i recieved it in good time and good condition, it works just as good as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Great so far.
Reviews.Author: JANE BENROTH
Reviews.Content: Got this for Christmas gift. This is taking very nice pics for point and shoot. Very easy. I am not ready for DSLR.  Just want something that isn't a phone and takes nice shots of my grandkids, wildlife.  Does better than a phone.

Reviews.Title: Great Semi Pro Camera
Reviews.Author: Ilse Cornejo
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera, exceed my expectations!!! It is easy to manage it, great quality of picture, even at night without using the flash-.

Reviews.Title: luv it
Reviews.Author: debbie
Reviews.Content: awesome purchase bought it for my daughter and first day out with camera she did not pick up her cell phone all day that is amazing she very much enjoyed her new nikon

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Andrew  P. DiMartino
Reviews.Content: Excellent high end camera for a beginner or intermediate user. It would be a 4 star camera for an experienced person who had other cameras. The camera has numerous features and will take a while to perfect a good command of the features and provides excellent results. In addition to my use I have introduced this camera to my family and it will most certainly exceed their needs for a good while and provide a lot of enjoyment

Reviews.Title: Super camera, great price
Reviews.Author: Claudia McCaffery
Reviews.Content: So many easy to use features and a great zoom lens. Can't believe how close we can get.Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Came Early: What is not to love
Reviews.Author: Hayden
Reviews.Content: I am thrilled with my camera and my neighbor has the same camera except black....My RED camera is a show stopper! I enjoy the ease of use and am even putting together videos of our grand baby.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Antonio
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my girlfriend and she loves it, it's a very good product, we are not photography pros but I think this is an excellent product.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix p5209
Reviews.Author: nml
Reviews.Content: Best camera I have ever had. It is user friendly. The features are easy to navigate and the pictures are beautiful. It is lightweight, easy to charge.  The computer program for editing pictures is also user friendly.  I absolutely love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Cloud
Reviews.Content: I normally use a larger 35mm but this one is great for the family to use plus the video is good quality.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Kristy
Reviews.Content: Great camera!  Great price!  Pictures are amazing!  If you don't want to deal with changing lenses, this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: User Friendly with Great Quality!
Reviews.Author: Cinthya Gomez
Reviews.Content: Totally user friendly camera, totally met my expectations and it has so many functionalities that you can take advantage and learn from as a non-professional user! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: Getting back into a great hobby
Reviews.Author: ARTHUR KEATING
Reviews.Content: Easy to handle and pictures and video are great. Good camera for somene like myself who has decide to get back into photography at a different level

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Louis D Williams
Reviews.Content: We visited the grand canyon a few months ago with only a 12mp pocket camera to record our memories. We were very disappointed with the results. We needed a much better camera that was not too pricey. The holiday sale of this excellent camera made it affordable. Excellent pictures with easy options. Wow we love this nikon. The zoom is just unbelievable. Great buy.

Reviews.Title: excellent product
Reviews.Author: Rosa Isela Ramos Galvis
Reviews.Content: the camera is easy to use and the pictures are very clear. The camera is excellent. I love it. I recommend

Reviews.Title: Best Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: What an amazing camera, it is very easy to use and it takes very clear pictures and videos. I would recommend this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: excellent product
Reviews.Author: Paulo Ricardo Zaniboni Gomes
Reviews.Content: best cost benefit in the market. The camera fits perfect to regular use and is a good starting point for a professional project.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Npolefox
Reviews.Content: love the Nikon Wi-Fi... took over 700 pictures on my vacation and they are great  really a good camera recommend highly

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: AlejandroGonzalez
Reviews.Content: The camera is great, the zoom is really something, however you've got yo get to know it to take advantage of al the funtions, love the flip screen, battery is not too bad, although I bought a cople more just in case, happy with this one..

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: catawnya
Reviews.Content: This camera is great and easy to use. The only reason I didn't give it a five star is because it doesn't have a RAW setting :(.

Reviews.Title: Dealbreaker EVF
Reviews.Author: MysticJaguar
Reviews.Content: You can tell that Nikon is really trying these days.  Back in the mid-2000's when the Digital Rebel was kicking up it's heels it seems Nikon had no clue on how to compete in the lower end of the digital market.  Today things are different.  I had a few Panansonic FZ cameras but abandoned them when the UI was getting long in the tooth and Panasonic was distracted.  I've since moved onto M 4/3 cameras and am generally happy.  Except when I need some lens reach.So I'm shopping around again.  I think Nikon is really trying in this compact segment of the market.  The P510 had alot going for it.  (The P510 was the breakthrough camera.  The P520 is more treading water and has some issues that make the P520 a misstep (battery life, focus hunting for most of the long range, etc.)  So my experience is one of shopping for a travel zoom and I've been doing a lot of research and putting hands on these cameras before purchase.  The IQ of the P510/P520 is really good for the compact segment.  The body design overall is nice.  The menu system is adequate.  However, personally, I really like the experience of a viewfinder.  A viewfinder really can put you into the scene and really concentrate on composition.  It is quite important.The problem is that the viewfinder on the P510/P520 is tiny.  I could not believe how small it was.  I felt like I was looking through the window of a very small fairy house.  It is not a usable viewfinder.  In fact it's almost like not having a viewfinder at all.  Note to camera makers:  *** 201,000 dot EVF is a joke *** .I don't know if Canon and Nikon and the rest realized this.  But the market is ripe for a small camera with a good sized viewfinder for $300 price point.  The Canon SX500/510 is a terrific sized small camera.  If you put a solid EVF on that kind of platform sales would go through the roof.  Stop playing the megapixel wars (this is happening now with settling back to 12-16 MP), stop the hyper zoom wars (50x is just silly), settle on quality, not just specs, and put a blessed viewfinder that is really good (1,440,000-dot) on a small body of decent zoom (max 24x to 30x) and watch a stellar hit in the making.I've decided to get a Fujifilm FinePix HS50EXR 16MP Digital Camera with 3-Inch LCD (Black) to quench my long lens urges.

Reviews.Title: TOP POINT AND SHOOT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: George M. Gill
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a good traveling camera for a European vacation that did not materialize. I find it even works well shooting my grandchildren's soccer games as the shutter can be set at a high speed priority. Quite different from the older film Cannon camera I had years ago.A fantastic zoom.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: cjbook
Reviews.Content: This camera takes wonderful photos with very little effort.  In fact it is hard to mess up a picture. One needs to know very little about the technical aspects of photography to get very good photos. The only thing I was disappointed with is the video function of the camera.  When taking videos, the camera does not focus well when panning to different subjects at varying distances from the camera. But other than that, it produces high end photos with the ease of a point and shoot.  Also, the 42x zoom is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: NOT the camera for you.
Reviews.Author: Fox2010
Reviews.Content: A friend let me demo his Nikon P510 (I think it was) for some airshow pics about a year ago. The camera had a very tough time locking focus on ANYTHING moving or still. Bizarre. Nevertheless, I decided on buying the upgraded Nikon P520 in hopes that my friend's camera was somehow defective. Sadly, this camera is exactly the same. Very disappointing. Even if you get lucky and the auto focus locks in where you want, many of the images are soft. Color is decent. Video however looks great. But I returned the P520 immediately. If you're looking for crisp images, you might be surprised at these recommendations which I feel found that elusive sweet spot in the mega-pixel/image processor dance: The Sony H50 (the Carl Zeiss lens unfettered by excessive noise is something to behold) and the Canon SX40 (which is what I just bought and am loving it). Good luck.

Reviews.Title: Cheaply made
Reviews.Author: Gordonaw
Reviews.Content: This camera has lots of good things, but is cheaply made, focuses very slow and is hard hold the focus.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Pogo
Reviews.Content: Great camera for retired RV'ers. Easy to use, great pictures, will hold hundreds of photos provided you have a memory card installed.

Reviews.Title: 2 Mos & Will Not Turn On
Reviews.Author: N. Brewer
Reviews.Content: I received my Nikon Coolpix P520 on 10/18/13 and was quite happy with the camera - also invested in the Nikon WU-1a, which worked flawlessly, and two expensive, fast photo cards.  Total cost of about $650 - no small thing.  I used the camera exactly 10 times over a 5 week period, the last use was on 11/11.  I picked the camera up on 12/11, prior to an important trip where I planned to use it, and it would not turn on.  I assumed that the battery had drained while not in use (?) and charged overnight.  Morning of 12/12 I put the camera in my purse and off we went.  Upon arrival at our destination, I tried to use the camera again and it would not turn on.  I've attempted charging, connecting to my laptop, removing and replacing battery, nothing will make this camera turn on.Net-net, I've invested $650 in a camera with accessories that allowed me to use it TEN TIMES over a FIVE WEEK period. Since I did not attempt to use the camera between 11/11 and 12/11, I missed the Amazon return deadline and am now stuck with a very expensive piece of garbage.  Shame on you, NIKON!  I thought I was making an investment in a trusted brand, but I cannot recommend this equipment.

Reviews.Title: Owned many Nikons, this one disappoints.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Spring
Reviews.Content: Aperture setting didn't work when it arrived. Also lacked basic features like threads for a UV filter. Slow auto-focus, no infrared assist in low light. But it does have built-in GPS (why I don't know) there are other things for that besides cameras.

Reviews.Title: Excellent price-product purchase
Reviews.Author: Andres Torresan
